job scheduler is what controls and

the way I like to analogize what is a

where you want to go and what you want

use the HPC system and so your you know
a batch job is intended to wait your
turn essentially right and so uh one
thing as new users to an HPC system is

different requirements of different

processing times but in every HPC system
there's a finite number of compute nodes
right machines that you can run on right
and so with the schedule is trying to do
is trying to fit all of those jobs into
you know a a reasonable schedule that
can get the jobs done within some set of
constraints right and so every scheduler
is configured in different ways of how
to um you know construct this schedule
right there's different priorities
there's different cues you can get in
and partitions as we'll see and it's not
an easy problem right the the schedule
is trying to do its best to
optimize a few things right it's trying
to minimize you know sort of the time to
completion of your jobs it's trying to
optimize the resource utilization of all
of the compute resources on the system
it's also trying to you know usually
maximize the throughput of getting as
many jobs through as possible right and
so it's really trying to play this you
know as I think on the last slide put
this multi-dimensional sort of petris
game right where it's trying to fit as
many jobs on all of the compute
resources as possible um you know but

mean there's it's not an easy problem
